headline: Trump Says JPMorgan, Bank of America Refused His Business
summary: (Bloomberg) -- President Donald Trump accused two of the nation’s largest banks of rejecting his business, as his administration was preparing an executive order threatening financial institutions who refused to work with certain customers on ideological grounds.Most Read from BloombergPATH Train Service Resumes After Fire at Jersey City StationMayor Asked to Explain $1.4 Billion of Wasted Johannesburg FundsChicago Curbs Hiring, Travel to Tackle $1 Billion Budget HoleAll Hail the Humble Speed Hu

headline: Trump targets big banks that deny accounts to conservatives
summary: The president said his JPMorgan Chase account was closed despite holding “hundreds of millions” of dollars, and that the CEO of BofA personally denied him an account.

raw.headline: Trump targets big banks that deny accounts to conservatives
raw.summary: The president said his JPMorgan Chase account was closed despite holding “hundreds of millions” of dollars, and that the CEO of BofA personally denied him an account.

headline: UBS to Pay $300M to Settle Credit Suisse Mortgage Securities Lawsuit
summary: UBS is set to pay $300M to settle a U.S. DOJ case over Credit Suisse's mortgage securities mis-selling, closing a key legacy legal issue.

raw.headline: UBS to Pay $300M to Settle Credit Suisse Mortgage Securities Lawsuit
raw.summary: UBS is set to pay $300M to settle a U.S. DOJ case over Credit Suisse's mortgage securities mis-selling, closing a key legacy legal issue.

headline: Trump says major US banks 'discriminated against me' as White House preps debanking executive order
summary: Debanking is back in the spotlight this week after President Trump said Tuesday that the country's two largest US banks, JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America, denied him as a customer.

raw.headline: Trump says major US banks 'discriminated against me' as White House preps debanking executive order
raw.summary: Debanking is back in the spotlight this week after President Trump said Tuesday that the country's two largest US banks, JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America, denied him as a customer.
